ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Michigan Power Limited Partnership FERC Electric Tariff Original Volume No. 1

record_data.record_plain_text: ?1. Availability: Seller makes electric energy, capacity, and ancillary services available under this tariff to any purchaser, except as prohibited below. a) PJM: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (including spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by the PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. (“PJM”) and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. b) MISO: Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. (“MISO”) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to MISO. c) Third Party Ancillary Services: Seller offers Regulation Service, Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service, Energy and Generator Imbalance Service, Operating Reserve-Spinning, Operating Reserve-Supplemental, and Primary Frequency Response Service. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; and (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier. Sales of Operating Reserve-Spinning and Operating Reserve-Supplemental will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except where the Commission has granted authorization. Sales of Regulation Service and Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except at rates not to exceed the buying public utility transmission provider’s OATT rate for the same service or where the Commission has granted authorization. 2. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Seller. 3. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Seller’s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits Seller’s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Seller’s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 4. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: Seller does not have any limitations on its market-based rate authority, except as may otherwise be provided in this Tariff. Seller has obtained waivers of: Subpart B and C of Part 35 regarding the filing of tariffs, with the exception of sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15 and 35.16; Part 41, regarding accounts; Part 101, regarding a uniform system of accounts; and Part 141, except section 141.15, regarding statements and reports, and with the exception that waiver of the provisions of Part 101 that apply to hydropower licenses is not granted with respect to licensed hydropower projects. Seller has blanket approval under Part 34 of the Commission’s regulations of future issuances of securities and assumptions of liabilities, subject to the objection of an interested party. Michigan Power Limited Partnership, Docket No. ER09-1364-000. 5. Seller Category: Seller is a Category 1 seller in all regions, as defined in 18 C.F.R. §35.36(a).
record_data.filing_title: Revised MBR Tariff - Designation as Category 1 Seller in Central Region
